timeline.bodyText: Maybe it would be nice to have a method 'checkRedundantmodifiers' with vararg argument of Modifiers, so you can call it once with a couple of modifiers

timeline.bodyText: Maybe it would be nice to rename it to sth more general like checkNestedType. Cause this method is used on both classes and interfaces, so a little bit confusing.
timeline.author: margarita-nedzelska-sonarsource
margarita-nedzelska-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText:
I'll suggest also to have a String representation of each modifier somewhere in utils or helpers. Cause it's not optimal to have modifier.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.US)  each time we need it.
Also, that's up to you, personally I prefer String.format() over String concat.
timeline.author: margarita-nedzelska-sonarsource

replies.bodyText:
I agree for the String.format().

it's not optimal to have modifier.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.US)

I refactored the code to have foundModifier.keyword().text(), I feel that it's slightly better (at least, we do not recompute toLowerCase...).
In any way, we will only call this code when an issue is reported, so it should not be too frequent.
@margarita-nedzelska-sonarsource does it look better to you this way?
replies.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource
